Class Assignment1

  • java.lang.Object
    • Assignment1

  • public class Assignment1
extends java.lang.Object
    Class that has multiple methods that are written using recursion or iteration Methods are called and used based on their big-O efficiency and time complexity
    Author:
    Nikhil Jindal

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Assignment1() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static java.lang.String addSubstring(java.lang.String input, java.lang.String substring, int index)
      Returns the substring added to the input given the specific index This method has a big-O time complexity of O(n), where n is the length of the input
      static boolean anagramChecker(java.lang.String x, java.lang.String y)
      Returns true if one string is an anagram of the other In the worst-case, this method has a big-O time complexity of O(n^2), where n is the length of either String
      static int getLength(java.lang.String input)
      Returns the length of a given input string This method has a big-O time complexity of O(1), since the String class keeps a count of the characters in a String so it does not have to iterate through the String
      static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
      Prompts the user for continuous inputs and allows them to select from each of the 6 different methods that are present in the class
      static int occurrenceCounter(java.lang.String input, java.lang.String substring)
      Returns the number of occurrences of a specified substring in the input string This method has a big-O time complexity of O(n * m), where n is the length of the input string and m is the length of the substring
      static boolean palindromeIterative(java.lang.String input)
      Finds whether the input is a palindrome in an iterative fashion This method has a big-O time complexity of O(n), where n is the length of the string that is inputted
      static boolean palindromeRecursive(java.lang.String input)
      Checks to see if the input is a palindrome using recursion This method has a big-O time complexity of O(n), where n is the length of the string that is inputted
      static java.lang.String sentenceReversal(java.lang.String input)
      Returns the sentence string in the reverse order of words This method has a big-O time complexity of O(n), where n is the length of the input String

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • palindromeIterative

        public static boolean palindromeIterative(java.lang.String input)
        Finds whether the input is a palindrome in an iterative fashion This method has a big-O time complexity of O(n), where n is the length of the string that is inputted
        Parameters:
        input - the possible palindrome
        Returns:
        true, only if the parameter is a palindrome

      • palindromeRecursive

        public static boolean palindromeRecursive(java.lang.String input)
        Checks to see if the input is a palindrome using recursion This method has a big-O time complexity of O(n), where n is the length of the string that is inputted
        Parameters:
        input - a possible palindrome
        Returns:
        true, only if the parameter is a palindrome

      • anagramChecker

        public static boolean anagramChecker(java.lang.String x,
                                     java.lang.String y)
        Returns true if one string is an anagram of the other In the worst-case, this method has a big-O time complexity of O(n^2), where n is the length of either String
        Parameters:
        x - first string to compare
        y - second string to compare
        Returns:
        true if one string is the anagram of another

      • addSubstring

        public static java.lang.String addSubstring(java.lang.String input,
                                            java.lang.String substring,
                                            int index)
        Returns the substring added to the input given the specific index This method has a big-O time complexity of O(n), where n is the length of the input
        Parameters:
        input - string which will include the substring
        substring - string to be added to the input
        index - index at which to insert substring
        Returns:
        the substring added to the input at the given index

      • getLength

        public static int getLength(java.lang.String input)
        Returns the length of a given input string This method has a big-O time complexity of O(1), since the String class keeps a count of the characters in a String so it does not have to iterate through the String
        Parameters:
        input - a string
        Returns:
        the length of the given input string

      • occurrenceCounter

        public static int occurrenceCounter(java.lang.String input,
                                    java.lang.String substring)
        Returns the number of occurrences of a specified substring in the input string This method has a big-O time complexity of O(n * m), where n is the length of the input string and m is the length of the substring
        Parameters:
        input - the string to search for the substring in
        substring - the string you want to search for
        Returns:
        the number of times that the substring is found in the input string

      • sentenceReversal

        public static java.lang.String sentenceReversal(java.lang.String input)
        Returns the sentence string in the reverse order of words This method has a big-O time complexity of O(n), where n is the length of the input String
        Parameters:
        input - a sentence string
        Returns:
        the sentence string in the reverse order of words

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Prompts the user for continuous inputs and allows them to select from each of the 6 different methods that are present in the class
        Parameters:
        args - no arguments should be passed in the main method
